content.question: ​The initial population size of an animal species is measured to be <math alttext="2000"><semantics><mn>2000</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. The population doubles every <math alttext="8"><semantics><mn>8</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> years. Which of the following functions gives the time, in years, as an output value, and a certain number <math alttext="x"><semantics><mi>x</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> for the population size as an input value?

choices.label: ​<math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses equals 1 over 8 log subscript 2 open parentheses x over 2000 close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>8</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mfenced><mfrac><mi>x</mi><mn>2000</mn></mfrac></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals log subscript 2 open parentheses fraction numerator 8 x over denominator 2000 end fraction close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mfenced><mfrac><mrow><mn>8</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow><mn>2000</mn></mfrac></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses equals 8 log subscript 2 open parentheses x over 2000 close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mfenced><mfrac><mi>x</mi><mn>2000</mn></mfrac></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="k open parentheses x close parentheses equals 2000 log subscript 8 x"><semantics><mrow><mi>k</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>2000</mn><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>8</mn></msub><mi>x</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

content.answer: ​<math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses equals 8 log subscript 2 open parentheses x over 2000 close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mfenced><mfrac><mi>x</mi><mn>2000</mn></mfrac></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

topic.text: 2.14: Logarithmic Function Context and Data Modeling

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
